title: Custom Derivation paths broken
body: - [ ] Feature request - [ x] Bug report - **Bug Report** - What is the current behavior? Custom derivation paths for Ethereum do not work - If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem Go to the MEW webpage, Access My Wallet -> Software -> Mnemonic Phrase -> 24 word -> No password -> HD Derivation Path -> Add Custom Path -> m/44'/60'/0' "Eth ledger" (I am trying to recover a legacy Ledger wallet generated with the almost-BIP44 derivation path) -> Select the custom path I just added -> **NO ADDRESSES CHANGE AND THE DERIVATION PATH LABEL STILL SAYS "ETHEREUM (TREZOR)"** The dropdown UI for my custom path appears to be bugged as well, with a white box off to the right inside the dropdown ^ After I click the path, no addresses change and the label still says "ETH (Trezor)" - What is the expected behavior? Derivation path changes to my custom path deriving on m/44'/60'/0' - What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Users are unable to use wallet derived on a custom path, or use the custom path feature at all - Please tell us about your environment: - Operating system OSX Mojave 10.14.3 - Browser and version Chrome Version 74.0.3729.131 (Official Build) (64-bit) Firefox 66.0.2 (64-bit)

~~Correcting the above: the path I'm trying to derive on is the old Ledger path m/44'/60'/0' (unused `change` address)~~
~~It appears the 'new' Ledger path since Ledger Live is m/44'/60'/0'/0 (with the `change` address)~~

Update
It looks like if your custom derivation path is the same as the Eth (Trezor) one, the UI stays on Eth (Trezor). I added the `m/44'/60'/0'` path as a custom path and it showed no wallet found. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10102484/58130727-a77ed800-7bd1-11e9-8a51-a4f46b23eaf5.png)

When I pressed "Access my wallet" I got this exception which I assume is because the derivation path without the `change` address cannot be read.
```

```

Thanks to everyone who worked on this. I confirmed I could view the wallets on 5.0.13 with derivation path `m/44'/60'/0'/'`

The first time I pressed "Access My Wallet" I got another strange error message, but I went back and tried a second time and it worked okay and I'm able to fully access the wallets. Might be worth investigating because it looked like the same message in t#1137 which is marked as closed, sorry I didn't grab the error message when it first came up.
@jcallin thanks! We're aware of that issue and are looking into it
